text.more:
This network was made using Plutarch's Roman Lives. Each interaction between two individuals or a group was noted. This graph was made using the ForceAtlas2 in Gephi. Size is determined by the number of connections an individual has. This network demonstrates Plutarch's focus on foreign wars and eastern leaders like Mithridates and Cleopatra. It also reveals his interest in Octavian.
This network has 530 nodes and 1190 edges. The most important nodes in this network are Antony (degree=127), Pompey (109), Caesar (107), Cicero (95), Cato (74), Brutus (62), Octavian (61), Crassus (44), Lucullus (44), and Cleopatra (36).
This is a highly connected network with an average path length of 3.125 and an average clustering coefficient of 66%.
text.intro: A social network made from Plutarch's Roman Lives after the death of Sulla. Includes Lucullus, Pompey, Crassus, Cicero, Cato the Younger, Brutus, Antony, and Caesar. This network has 530 nodes and 1190 edges.
text.title: Networking Plutarch's Roman Lives After Sulla
